verses.verse: (1 Tim. 4:2) who, being past feeling, (1 Pet. 4:3) have given themselves over to lewdness, to work all uncleanness with greediness.
But you have not so learned Christ,
if indeed you have heard Him and have been taught by Him, as the truth is in Jesus:
that you (Col. 3:8) put off, concerning your former conduct, the old man which grows corrupt according to the deceitful lusts,
and ((Rom. 12:2; Col. 3:10)) be renewed in the spirit of your mind,
and that you ((Rom. 6:4; 7:6; 12:2; 2 Cor. 5:17; Col. 3:10)) put on the new man which was created according to God, in true righteousness and holiness.
(Do Not Grieve the Spirit) Therefore, putting away lying, (Zech. 8:16; Eph. 4:15; Col. 3:9) “Let each one of you speak truth with his neighbor,” for (Rom. 12:5) we are members of one another.
(Ps. 4:4; 37:8) “Be angry, and do not sin”: do not let the sun go down on your wrath,
((Rom. 12:19; James 4:7); 1 Pet. 5:9) nor give place to the devil.

Let him who stole steal no longer, but rather (Acts 20:35; 1 Cor. 4:12; Gal. 6:10) let him labor, working with his hands what is good, that he may have something (Luke 3:11; 1 Thess. 4:12) to give him who has need.
(Matt. 12:34; Eph. 5:4; Col. 3:8) Let no corrupt word proceed out of your mouth, but (1 Thess. 5:11) what is good for necessary edification, (Col. 3:16) that it may impart grace to the hearers.
And (Is. 7:13) do not grieve the Holy Spirit of God, by whom you were sealed for the day of redemption.
(Rom. 3:14; Col. 3:8, 19) Let all bitterness, wrath, anger, clamor, and (James 4:11) evil speaking be put away from you, (Titus 3:3) with all malice.
And ((Matt. 6:14); 2 Cor. 6:10) be kind to one another, tenderhearted, ((Mark 11:25; Luke 6:37)) forgiving one another, even as God in Christ forgave you.
(Walk in Love) Therefore ((Matt. 5:48); Luke 6:36; Eph. 4:32) be imitators of God as dear (1 Pet. 1:14-16) children.

And (1 Thess. 4:9) walk in love, (John 15:9; Gal. 1:4; 1 John 3:16) as Christ also has loved us and given Himself for us, an offering and a sacrifice to God (Ex. 29:18, 25; 2 Cor. 2:14, 15) for a sweet-smelling aroma.
But fornication and all (Col. 3:5-7) uncleanness or ((Luke 12:15)) covetousness, let it not even be named among you, as is fitting for saints;

(Matt. 12:34, 35; Eph. 4:29; Col. 3:8; James 1:21) neither filthiness, nor (Titus 3:9) foolish talking, nor coarse jesting, (Rom. 1:28) which are not fitting, but rather (Phil. 4:6; Col. 3:17; (1 Thess. 5:18)) giving of thanks.
For this you know, that no fornicator, unclean person, nor covetous man, who is an idolater, has any (1 Cor. 6:9, 10; Col. 3:5) inheritance in the kingdom of Christ and God.
Let no one deceive you with empty words, for because of these things the wrath of God comes upon the sons of disobedience.
Therefore do not be (1 Tim. 5:22) partakers with them.
(Walk in Light) For you were once darkness, but now you are (1 Thess. 5:5) light in the Lord. Walk as children of light
(for (Gal. 5:22) the fruit of the Spirit is in all goodness, righteousness, and truth),
((Rom. 12:1, 2)) finding out what is acceptable to the Lord.
And have (1 Cor. 5:9; 2 Cor. 6:14) no fellowship with the unfruitful works of darkness, but rather expose them.
(Rom. 1:24) For it is shameful even to speak of those things which are done by them in secret.
But ((John 3:20, 21)) all things that are exposed are made manifest by the light, for whatever makes manifest is light.
Therefore He says: ((Is. 26:19; 60:1; Rom. 13:11)) “Awake, you who sleep, Arise from the dead, And Christ will give you light.”
(Walk in Wisdom) (Col. 4:5) See then that you walk circumspectly, not as fools but as wise,
(Col. 4:5) redeeming the time, (Eccl. 11:2) because the days are evil.
(Col. 4:5) Therefore do not be unwise, but ((Rom. 12:2); Col. 1:9) understand (1 Thess. 4:3) what the will of the Lord is.
And (Prov. 20:1; 23:31; Rom. 13:13; 1 Cor. 5:11; 1 Thess. 5:7) do not be drunk with wine, in which is dissipation; but be filled with the Spirit,
speaking to one another (Acts 16:25) in psalms and hymns and spiritual songs, singing and making (James 5:13) melody in your heart to the Lord,
